sets.name: Super Smash Sweeper
sets.description:
• Shell Smash and Skill Link more than make up for Cloyster's weak Attack stat, making it a formidable sweeper that Focus Sash and Mimikyu can't easily stop.

  • Ice Shard may seem like overkill, but it helps for not only picking off weakened threats, but getting around priority attacks from Breloom, Dragapult, and Meowscarada.

  • Rock Blast is Closyer's best shot at dealing with the many Tera Fires that will attempt to deal with Icicle Spear, as well as OHKOing Volcarona.

Tera Types

  • Ice: The increased damage from Tera Ice makes it very difficult for Pokemon to wall Cloyster without resisting it, with even Corviknight getting OHKOed by +2 Adamant Icicle Spear after Stealth Rock damage.

  • Fire: While boosted Tera Blast actually does less damage to Corviknight than Tera Ice Icicle Spear, Tera Fire otherwise helps Cloyster muscle past Steel-types it traditionally struggles to beat, such as Scizor.

  • Ghost: Since Cloyster will often be at extremely low health after Shell Smash, Tera Ghost helps it avoid getting revenge killed by Breloom's Mach Punch. It also provides coverage against Gholdengo with Tera Blast.

  • Normal: Tera Normal offers no offensive benefits to Cloyster, but it does prevent Mimikyu from revenge killing it with Shadow Sneak.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Considering Cloyster's paper thin Special Defense, Focus Sash gives Cloyster by far the most set up opportunities.

  • King's Rock: King's Rock is a risky option for making Cloyster difficult to set up, but it does give Icicle Spear a 41% chance of flinching.

sets.name: Disruptor
sets.description:
• Gengar's useful immunities and fast Encore give it a niche as an incredibly disruptive Pokemon, especially if taking the corrective predictive risks.

  • Destiny Bond is excellent at making foes second guess attacking Gengar. When slower foes don't take the bait and use a setup move, Gengar can punish them with Encore.

  • Thunder Wave is great at crippling faster sweepers if Gengar's Focus Sash is intact, and punishing fast, common switch-ins such as Hydreigon.

  • Sludge Bomb covers Meowscarada and Fairy-types, in addition to being Gengar's most powerful attack.

  • Dazzling Gleam OHKOes Hydreigon after Stealth Rock damage and is an appealing secondary STAB move when using Tera Fairy.

  • Focus Blast is Gengar's best shot at beating Kingambit outside of Destiny Bond.

  • Will-O-Wisp does a great job of crippling bulky sweepers that Gengar can be forced to Destiny Bond against, such as Dragonite and Tera Annihilape.

Tera Types

  • Normal: Tera Normal Gengar can turn slower Ghost-types such as Mimikyu and Annihilape into easy Encore targets.

  • Fairy: A Dragon-type immunity gives Gengar new Encore targets and better threatens Dragon-types.

  • Flying: Earthquake is a common attack against Gengar, so Tera Flying can turn the tables effectively. It also takes advantage of common Fissure users such as Dondozo and Garganacl.

  • Dark: A Dark Tera type lets Gengar surprise Espathra, letting it Encore Stored Power and potentially ruin its sweep.

sets.name: Imposter
sets.description: With Imposter, Chansey transforms into a far bulkier version of the opposing Pokemon, which can be further bolstered by Eviolite. This provides a myriad of benefits, including blanket checking most Pokemon, scouting sets, and PP stalling less threatening foes. While Eviolite is usually the best item, Toxic Orb provides much better matchups against Poison Heal users while Covert Cloak is useful against Nuzzle and Spirit Shackle users. The given moves offer the most utility in the rare situations Chansey is not transformed, like phazing Substitute users, pivoting, acting as a cleric, and removing Chansey's Toxic Orb. Offensive threats such as Zacian-C and Poison Heal users such as Arceus-Fairy appreciate the information Imposter Chansey provides through scouting, with Poison Heal users also acting as Knock Off absorbers. Imposter Chansey appreciates slow pivoting from Pokemon like Dondozo and RegenVest Ting-Lu for safe scouting; these Pokemon can also provide Knock Off support, aiding against Judgment users like Miraidon that can otherwise defeat Imposter Chansey. Tera Normal gives Chansey a STAB boost on Judgment, improving its matchup into Pokemon like Miraidon, while Tera Fire and Tera Ghost are useful against Zacian-C and trapping moves, respectively.

sets.name: FIREFIGHTER
sets.description:
• Will-O-Wisp and Intimidate make Paldean Tauros-F a potent check to physical attackers, notably enabling it reliably check Kingambit.

  • Raging Bull provides a powerful STAB attack that can also break screens, allowing Paldean Tauros-F’s teammates to clean up more easily.

  • Body Press is valuable because unlike Close Combat, it doesn’t cause defense drops.

  • Will-O-Wisp allows Paldean Tauros-F to take on a wider array of physical attackers by threatening burn.

  • Rock Tomb allows Paldean Tauros-F to check Volcarona despite its meager Special Defense.

  • Paldean Tauros-F should generally avoid Terastallizing, as its typing is a big part of what lets it act as such a sturdy check to Kingambit and other massive threats, such as Baxcalibur.

Items

  • Leftovers makes up for Paldean Tauros-F’s lack of manual recovery.

  • Sitrus Berry can be used as an alternative to Leftovers if they are otherwise unavailable.

  • Heavy-Duty Boots is worth considering, as it allows Paldean Tauros-F to switch around more freely in after entry hazards are set.

sets.name: Offensive Screen Smasher
sets.description:
• Paldean Tauros-F is fast enough to outspeed key threats such as Hydreigon and Mimikyu, making an offensive set viable.

  • Raging Bull might not be as powerful as Flare Blitz, but its ability to break Reflect and Light Screen make it an essential attack.

  • Flame Charge can give Paldean Tauros-F an unexpected late-game win condition, letting it outspeed threats such as Dragapult and Meowscarada.

  • Rock Tomb's speed control is useful when sacrificing Paldean Tauros-F against a threat and prevents Dragonite from getting easy Speed boosts.

  • Despite this set's offensive nature, Will-O-Wisp is good for punishing Dragonite, Dragapult, and foes that may Terrastallize, such as Kingambit.ADD PERIOD

  • Bulk Up is another potentially surprising win condition in the late stages of the game, and helps against Corviknight.

Tera Types

  • Grass: A Grass Tera type makes Paldean Tauros-F far less vulnerable to Rotom-W and Palafin-H.

  • Fairy: When paired with Tera Blast, a Fairy Tera type means Dragon-types will no longer wall Paldean Tauros-F.

Items

  • Eject Pack: With Close Combat, this will give Paldean Tauros-F a powerful, one-time use pivot option.

  • Assault Vest: Patching up Paldean Tauros-F's mediocre Special Defense gives it a better shot against Dragapult and Rotom-W when Terastallizing.

  • Mirror Herb: Mirror Herb punishes setup sweepers even more effectively and pairs especially well with Intimidate.

  • Life Orb: This high value item can be tough to slot in, but the increased power makes sweeping with a Speed boost much easier.

sets.name: Extreme Killernite
sets.description:
• With Tera Normal, Dragonite can do its best impression of Arceus, with a powerful Extreme Speed that makes Dragonite a great revenge killer and sweeper in one!

  • Earthquake is Dragonite's strongest tool against most Steel-types, but Fire Punch is worth considering to hit Corviknight.

  • While a Dragon-type STAB move is useful against opposing Dragons and is Dragonite's best shot at picking off weakened Dondozo, it's not strictly needed on this Dragonite.

  • A Jolly nature allows Dragonite to outspeed Dragapult after one use of Dragon Dance, but Adamant is a reasonable consideration if revenge killing with Extreme Speed is more important.

Items

  • Lum Berry: Lum Berry gives Dragonite more set up opportunities against status moves and pairs particularly well with Outrage to cure confusion.

  • Silk Scarf: This item goes all in on Extreme Speed's revenge killing power, without conflicting with Multiscale.

  • Life Orb: Life Orb doesn't pair well with Multiscale on paper, but the power boost it gives Extreme Speed can let Dragonite clean teams up earlier.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
• Choice Band makes Dragonite both an effective late-game cleaner with Tera Normal Extreme Speed and effective at breaking through many defensive Pokemon.

  • Outrage is strong enough to potentially 2HKO Impish Dondozo after Stealth Rock damage, though it leaves Dragonite very vulnerable to getting revenge killed.

sets.name: Dragon Dance
sets.description:
• Dragonite uses both Multiscale and the unpredictability of Terastallization to become an extremely dangerous sweeper!

Tera Types

  • Steel: Dragonite has superb synergy with Tera Steel, resisting most of its weaknesses, and particularly helping against Fairy-types and opposing Dragon-types. When paired with Safety Goggles, this Dragonite can take advantage of Amoonguss effectively as well.

  • Fire: With Tera Fire, Dragonite deals massive damage to Corviknight with +1 Fire Punch, in addition to gaining a useful Fairy-type resistance.

Items

  • Lum Berry: With a Lum Berry, Dragonite can set up against status moves and use Outrage with less risk late game.

  • Safety Goggles: Safety Goggles blocks Spore from Breloom and Amoonguss, though it is less versatile than Lum Berry.

  • Life Orb: Life Orb doesn't fit well with Multiscale, but it's notable for allowing Tera Fire Dragonite a 75% chance to OHKO Corviknight after Dragon Dance.

sets.name: Dragon Dance
sets.description: Dragon Dance + Extreme Speed Aerilate Dragonite serves as a powerful offensive threat that can check sweepers like Dragapult. Earthquake hits non-Earth Eater Gholdengo and Ice Scales Garganacl, Fire Blast breaks through Avalugg, Ice Beam deals with Hippowdown, Garchomp, and Altaria, and Tera Blast can generally chip neutral Fur Coat users like Iron Hands. Heavy-Duty Boots affords the most longevity, whereas Sharp Beak and Life Orb are better suited for hyper offense teams. Dragonite does tend to struggle to break through bulky Fur Coat walls, so it appreciates powerful wallbreakers like Sheer Force Iron Valiant; in return, Dragonite can use Extreme Speed to cover faster offensive threats. Dragonite also appreciates teammates like Ice Scales Corviknight, which can provide Defog support for non-Heavy Duty Boots variants and defensively handle anti-priority users like Queenly Majesty Polteageist.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description: Choice Band Aerilate Dragonite serves as a potent offensive cleaner and revenge killer, capitalizing on its priority -ate Speed to threaten fast offensive Pokemon like Iron Bundle and Dragapult. If forgoing recovery, Thunder Punch can help break through Corviknight. For the 4th moveslot, Earthquake is generally best to hit foes like non-Earth Eater Gholdnego and Kingambit, while Fire Blast is an option to break Avalugg and Tera Blast chips neutral Fur Coat users like Hippowdown. This set appreciates Rapid Spin and Defog support from the likes of Corviknight and Iron Treads, respectively, which can also pivot Dragonite into offensive threats it normally couldn't switch into. Dragonite pairs up well with wallbreakers like Sheer Force Iron Valiant to help break through Fur Coat users; in return, Dragonite threatens fast offensive threats with Extreme Speed.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description:
• With a fantastic typing and priority, Azumarill makes a good choice for a team's bulky Water-type.

  • Superpower often forces Azumarill to switch out, but its reliability against common Hydreigon Tera types is very valuable, in addition to OHKOing Kingambit.

  • Ice Spinner is Azumarill's best option against Amoonguss.

Tera Types

  • Fire: Tera Fire gives Azumarill a vital immunity to Will-O-Wisp, as well as letting it deal massive damage to Corviknight with Tera Blast.

  • Water: While it won't help Azumarill much in direct matchups, Tera Water will make it easier to clean weakened teams with Aqua Jet.

  • Grass: Tera Grass lets Azumarill beat Breloom and Rotom-W.

Items

  • Assault Vest: Assault Vest lets Azumarill act as a Hydreigon check; even Choice Specs-boosted Tera Electric Tera Blast fails to OHKO it.

  • Choice Band: The big power boost from Choice Band gives Azumarill an 81.3% chance to OHKO Rotom-H with Aqua Jet.

vgc2023.overview:
• Murkrow is one of the metagame's premier support Pokemon due to being the only Pokemon with Prankster and Tailwind. Murkrow also has a plethora of other support tools, including Haze, Taunt, and Perish Song.

  • Murkrow is commonly used with Haze alongside Pokemon that drop their own stats, such as Gholdengo or Draco Meteor Hydreigon, or to enable Earthquake Garchomp with its Flying typing. Prankster + Taunt also safely shuts down Trick Room teams, although Murkrow must be wary of a potential Fake Out or priority-blocking abilities, such as Psychic Surge from Indeedee-F and Armor Tail from Farigiraf.

  • However, Murkrow has many exploitable weaknesses, especially fearing powerful Fairy-, Ice-, and Rock-type moves in the format. It also relies heavily on its support moves, leaving it vulnerable to Taunt.

sets.name: Tailwind
sets.description:
• Foul Play punishes the metagame's strong physical attackers, most notably 2HKOing Adamant Dragonite and Garchomp. Brave Bird is an alternative option that handles Flying-weak Pokemon such as Meowscarada, Lilligant, and Breloom with ease.

  • Murkrow's Haze allows it to check dangerous threats, such as Dondozo, Nasty Plot Gholdengo, and Swords Dance Garchomp. Haze can also reset its partner's stat drops from the likes of Intimidate, Parting Shot, and Snarl, or attacks that lower the user's stats.

  • Taunt allows it to also disrupt support Pokemon such as Lilligant, Talonflame, and Amoonguss, as well as crippling Pokemon such as Iron Defense Garganacl. Quash is also a viable option to maintain speed control even in Trick Room, and it can neutralize threats such as Maushold and Garchomp in opposing Tailwind.

  • Other viable, but not as prominent, options for Murkrow include Protect and Perish Song. Protect allows it to scout the opponent and block Fake Out. Perish Song is an interesting option that gives Murkrow a win condition alongside its supportive roles and can force switches before that.

  • Eviolite gives Murkrow the bulk needed to stay on the field and disrupt the opponent with Haze and Taunt. Focus Sash can be used when Murkrow is expected to be KOed quickly, for example Murkrow can also hold Covert Cloak to bypass Fake Out.

  • 52 Speed EVs allow Murkrow to get the jump on Annihilape in Tailwind, and the overall bulk investment allows Murkrow to survive Tera Normal Dragonite's Extreme Speed and Timid Gholdengo's Thunderbolt.

  • Tera Ghost allows Murkrow to bypass Fake Out on sets not running Covert Cloak, while Tera Dark adds more power to Foul Play in rare late-game one-on-one scenarios and it keeps Murkrow's immunity to Prankster status moves.

sets.name: Calm Mind Support
sets.description:
• The old reliable special wall is still relevant, but with a twist: Blissey uses Calm Mind so it isn't entirely passive and fully takes advantage of Tera Blast giving it STAB no matter what type it is.

  • Shadow Ball is still a reasonable option for dealing good damage to Gholdengo and Dragapult regardless of Blissey's Tera type, and also breaks Mimikyu's Disguise.

  • Thunder Wave is Blissey's most consistent way of spreading paralysis, though it's vulnerable to Taunt and Gholdengo switch-ins.

  • With Fling and Light Ball, Blissey can paralyze Gholdengo, Ground-types, and users of Taunt alike, though Covert Cloak holders are immune to the effect. Fling also gets rid of Choice items from Trick users.

  • Trick with Lagging Tail cripples even Electric-types and is a more direct way of getting rid of troublesome Choice items that Blissey would normally succumb to.

Tera Types

  • Ghost: The Fighting-type immunity comes in handy for Blissey, though it does become more vulnerable to Gholdengo.

  • Dark: Dark Tera type not only gives Blissey a less exploitable STAB move against Gholdengo, but it also ruins Espathra's attempts to break through Blissey with Stored Power, at least forcing a Calm Mind war instead of a total loss.

  • Flying: Under Flying Tera type, Blissey gains a handy resistance to Fighting and no longer has to worry about Fissure from Dondozo.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description: With Ice Scales, Blissey is a titanic special wall that checks prominent attackers like Gholdengo and Iron Bundle; Good as Gold is an alternative to stop Taunt users like Chi-Yu, which otherwise take advantage of Blissey. Thunder Wave lets Blissey cripple foes such as Corviknight and Kingambit, which could otherwise switch into it free of charge, while Calm Mind helps Blissey keep up with foes like Nasty Plot Gholdengo, ensuring they do not break past it. Shadow Ball lets Blissey hit Ghost-types like Dragapult and Gholdengo, denying them setup opportunities. Heavy-Duty Boots is preferred to avoid entry hazard chip damage from repeated switch-ins, but Leftovers provides passive recovery. Physically defensive teammates like Fur Coat Avalugg and Flogres help cover the physical attackers that threaten Blissey, like Aerilate Dragonite and Dragon Rush Dragapult. Slow but powerful wallbreakers such as Slither Wing and Ceruledge appreciate Blissey paralyzing offensive foes, giving them more chances to wallbreak.

vgc2023.overview:
• Pelipper's role is primarily to set rain for its teammates, but functions it as an offensive support Pokemon with fully accurate Hurricanes and access to Tailwind and Wide Guard.

  • Rain boosts the power of Water-type teammates such as Palafin, Floatzel, and Drednaw, and it also weakens Fire-type moves for Fire-weak partners such as Amoonguss, Gholdengo, and Kingambit.

  • Pelipper's overall bulk is lacking, particularly specially, and super effective attacks like Thunderbolt from Gholdengo or Rotom-W are capable of OHKOing it.

sets.name: Pelipper
sets.description:
• Hurricane's full accuracy in Rain makes it mandatory on Pelipper. It provides consistent damage and threatens the Grass-type Pokemon that resist Water.

  • Hydro Pump is Pelipper's best Water-type attack but can be forgone if accuracy is a concern. Helping Hand paired with a fast Water-type Pokemon can compensate for the lack of reliable Water-type damage.

  • Wide Guard can be used over Protect to answer ubiquitous spread moves such as Gholdengo's Make it Rain and Sylveon's Hyper Voice.

  • Focus Sash ensures Pelipper survives attacks from Pokemon that might otherwise outspeed and OHKO it, such as Hydreigon and Annihilape. Damp Rock extends the uptime of Pelipper's rain-reliant teammates, allowing them to beat bulkier teams without requiring repeat switch-ins.

  • 252 Speed EVs with a Timid nature allow Pelipper to outspeed the entire metagame with Tailwind, as well as some notable Choice Scarf threats such as Annihilape.

  • A Ground Tera type grants Pelipper an immunity to Electric and a resistance to Rock, which are its main concerns. With a Grass Tera type, it instead resists Electric, but this grants an immunity to Spore and Rage Powder.

sets.name: Focus Sash Spore
sets.description:
• Since it can sleep foes without restriction, Breloom is a monstrous Focus Sash foe that every team needs to prepare for!

  • Bulldoze is Breloom's best option against Gholdengo and provides valuable speed control.

  • Close Combat lets Breloom muscle past bulkier threats more easily, such as Tera Steel Garganacl.

  • Rock Tomb provides speed control and ensures that Breloom is not walled by Flying-types such as Dragonite.

Tera Types

  • Fighting: Breloom doesn't Terastallize often, but Fighting Tera is a good choice for picking off foes more easily with Mach Punch.

  • Ground: Tera Ground-boosted Bulldoze has a 93.8% chance to OHKO 4 HP Gholdengo, making Breloom a situational lure. It also severely punishes Rotom-W that attempt to Volt Switch out, and Hippowdon that don't Terastallize.

vgc2023.overview:
• Torkoal has exclusive access to drought, making it the most consistent sun setter in the format. Its rock-bottom Speed and sun-boosted Eruption make it an absolutely terrifying Trick Room sweeper, capable of chunking or outright KOing a majority of the metagame.

  • Heavy support in the form of Trick Room and/or Chlorophyll + After You Lilligant is mandatory. Torkoal also welcomes priority protection from the likes of Farigiraf and Indeedee, both of which set Trick Room as well. While Torkoal has high enough bulk to shrug off most priority moves, it hates having the power of Eruption lowered, and Fake Out wastes its Trick Room turns.

  • Torkoal faces stiff competition from Armarouge due to Armarouge's superior support capabilities and better coverage options, in spite of its lower overall damage output. To make matters worse, Tera Grass, Pyschic, or Dark Armarouge and Ceruledge wall most Torkoal sets endlessly, using Flash Fire, Wide Guard, and Terastillization removing their weakness to Earth Power. However, Armarouge pairs well with Torkoal by giving it protection from Earthquake and enjoying sun itself.

  • Most Dragon-types such as Garchomp and Assault Vest Hydreigon can take everything Torkoal can dish out and threaten it in return. Guts Hariyama can protect against Garchomp's Earthquake with Wide Guard and threatens an OHKO on Garchomp. Lilligant can put them to sleep and threatens Garchomp with Leaf Storm. Hatterene is a more offensive Trick Room setter that threatens the Dragon-types with Dazzling Gleam.

sets.name: Trick Room Offense
sets.description:
• This set makes full use of Torkoal's nuclear power. Eruption vaporizes nearly anything without a resistance or immunity to Fire after Terrastilization. Heat Wave gives it a mostly-reliable spread option after taking damage. Earth Power hits opposing Fire-types and gives Torkoal a single-target option to get around Wide Guard.

  • Tera Fire is the go-to option to maximize Torkoal's damage. Tera Flying and Grass removes its weaknesses, which helps greatly against the ever-frequent Ground-type attacks, but are generally not worth it.

  • Solar Beam is an option to hit Water-types meaningfully and to hit Rock- and Ground-types a little harder than Earth Power. Tera Blast is a niche option if Torkoal is running Tera Flying, turning the tables on Tera Grass Armarouge and Ceruledge attempting to wall it. Choice Specs would push Torkoal's offensive capabilities onto another planet, but it makes Torkoal even easier to exploit with Wide Guard, Flash Fire, and attacks in general—it can't viably run Protect.

sets.name: Specsmence Returns
sets.description:
• Salamence finds a niche for itself among other Dragon-types due to outspeeding Hydreigon, the most prominent special attacking Dragon-type. It also has a useful typing that provides a handy Fissure immunity, and it has an incredible ability in Intimidate.

  • Hurricane's accuracy may not be very reliable, but the sheer damage output makes it worth it.

  • Air Slash is much weaker than Hurricane, but the more reliable accuracy and flinch chance make it a reasonable alternative. It becomes especially attractive if using Tera Flying.

  • If not using Tera Fairy, Hydro Pump is a reasonable choice that deals massive damage to Hippowdon and Fire-types without risking Draco Meteor.

Tera Types

  • Fairy: Not only does Tera Fairy give Salamence an edge against many Dragon-types, but it also pairs extremely well with Intimidate, transforming Salamence into an effective hit-and-run threat.

  • Steel: Tera Steel comes in handy against Dragon- and Fairy-types alike, though the added weaknesses to Ground and Fighting make it less effective at taking physical hits with Intimidate.

  • Flying: Air Slash becomes much easier to justify with Tera Flying, and if you're willing to risk it, Hurricane can be used to become almost impossible to wall with Choice Specs.

  • Fire: Tera Fire doesn't offer as much defensive utility, but the powerful STAB attacks come in handy against Steel-types like Corviknight.

  • Dragon: Tera Dragon trades defensive advantages for an extremely powerful Draco Meteor that catches defensive foes like Dondozo by surprise.

Items

  • Choice Specs: With Salamence already standing at a decent Speed tier, it can get away with Choice Specs, making it extremely difficult to wall outside of using Blissey.

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf trades wallbreaking power for the ability to get the jump on major offensive threats, such as Dragapult, Meowscarada, and Garchomp.

sets.name: Physically Offensive
sets.description:
• Salamence is somewhat overshadowed by other Dragon-types, but it has a trick up its claws: Dual Wingbeat, which OHKOes Breloom and Meowscarada through their Focus Sash.

  • Earthquake is the best option for hitting Steel-types such as Gholdengo hard, but Fire Blast is Salamence's best shot at 2HKOing Corviknight.

Tera Types

  • Flying: With a Flying Tera type, a boosted Dual Wingbeat has a 75% chance to OHKO offensive Mimikyu through its disguise!

  • Electric: Tera Electric lets Tera Blast Salamence OHKO Azumarill and potentially 2HKO Dondozo after Stealth Rock damage.

Abilities

  • Intimidate: While Salamence isn't particularly bulky, Intimidate makes setting up far easier when paired with a Flying Tera type that removes Salamence's common weaknesses.

  • Moxie: With Moxie, Salamence has the potential to seriously punish Breloom leads or snowball through teams even without Dragon Dance.

sets.name: Mixed Attacker
sets.description:
• Salamence's great mixed offenses and decent Speed give it a niche.

  • Dual Wingbeat lets Salamence OHKO Breloom regardless of its Focus Sash, something very few Pokemon can do.

  • Draco Meteor deals massive damage to Dondozo, usually doing more than 50% to physically defensive ones.

  • Substitute makes the Dondozo match-up even better, making Yawn a non-issue. It's also a good way to scout Terastallization against slower threats.

Tera Types

  • Steel: A Steel Tera type covers a lot of Salamence's weaknesses and makes dealing with Mimikyu much easier.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy gives Salamence a great match-up against most Dragon-types, and pairs especially well with Intimidate to turn Salamence into a good hit-and-run attacker.

  • Fire: With a Fire Tera type, Salamence gains a resistance to Fairy-type attacks and deals massive damage to Assault Vest Magnezone.

  • Electric: Tera Electric gives Salamence a great tool against Dondozo with Tera Blast.

  • Dragon: While this Tera type fails to help Salamence much defensively, it makes Draco Meteor 2HKO physically defensive Dondozo.

sets.name: Swords Dance Sweeper
sets.description:
• The classic Swords Dance sweeper is still a big threat, thanks to its good bulk, unique Speed tier, and excellent use of Terastallization.

  • Outrage is by far Garchomp's strongest STAB move, but the lock-in effect makes it very vulnerable to Fairy-types such as Mimikyu.

  • Despite its low base power, Fire Fang is Garchomp's best shot at breaking past Corviknight after a Swords Dance. If Garchomp is almost always Terastallized on your team, Tera Blast can be used instead.

Tera Types

  • Steel: A Steel Tera type has excellent synergy with Garchomp's typing, letting it more effectively tackle faster Dragon-types, Mimikyu, and Ice Shard from the likes of Baxcalibur and Cloyster.

  • Fire: While the Stealth Rock weakness is unfortunate against bulkier teams, a Fire Tera type lets Life Orb Garchomp OHKO Corviknight with a +2 Fire Fang 93.8% of the time.

  • Ground: While the defensive synergy with Garchomp's former typing isn't that strong, a Ground Tera type lets Garchomp become more of a hit-and-run attacker with Earthquake, dealing good damage to Dondozo before being forced out by Yawn.

Items

  • Life Orb: This is the best option for damage output.

  • Lum Berry: Lum Berry lets Garchomp deal with major status users more easily, such as Dragapult and Breloom.

  • Mirror Herb: Mirror Herb gives Garchomp the potential to severely punish set-up sweepers such as Dragapult and Dragonite, with the right Tera type.

  • Focus Sash: Surviving shocking attacks with Focus Sash gives Garchomp new sweeping and revenge killing potential.

sets.name: Entry Hazard Setter
sets.description:
• While Garchomp is known for its offensive prowess, it can also support its teammates with entry hazards and phazing.

  • Bulldoze brings utility against Choice Scarf and naturally fast grounded opponents, but its lower Base Power makes Garchomp more passive against bulkier Pokemon.

Tera Types

  • Steel: Terastallizing into a Steel-type makes Garchomp resist Dragon-, Ice- and Fairy-type attacks, making it a safer lead against opposing Dragon-type leads, at the cost of being vulnerable to Tera Fire Dragons and Fighting- and Ground-types.

  • Fairy: Fairy Tera type provides Garchomp with an immunity to Dragon while making it weak to Tera Steel Dragons and Gholdengo.

EV spreads

  • 188 HP / 236 Def / 84 Spe with Impish: This EV spread lets Garchomp survive Adamant Dragonite's Outrage while also outspeeding it.

  • 252 HP / 124 Def / 132 Spe with Jolly: While this spread doesn't take physical hits as well, it lets Garchomp outspeed Gholdengo, Glimmora, and Rotom-W. This allows for scouting Rotom-W's item, as a Choice Scarf variant of it will be faster.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry: This prevents Choice Band Dragapult from OHKOing Garchomp, as it activates after the first hit, and the HP recovered doesn't allow the second one to get the KO, unless Dragapult is Terastallized into a Dragon-type.

  • Rocky Helmet: Combined with Rough Skin, Rocky Helmet severely punishes contact moves.

  • Red Card: With Red Card, Garchomp will be able to phaze foes Terastallizing into a Fairy type once.

sets.name: Choice Item
sets.description:
• Garchomp's fantastic Speed tier and power make it a fine Choice item user, especially when it can catch its softer checks off guard, such as Dragapult and Corviknight.

  • Stone Edge deals massive damage to common Tera Flying Pokemon such as Gholdengo, and it prevents it from being walled by Tera Fairy Rotom-W.

  • Rock Tomb is fairly weak, but the speed control can be very useful on Choice Scarf variants if sacrificing Garchomp.

  • With Tera Steel, Iron Head lets Garchomp beat Tera Fairy Levitate foes such as Rotom-W.

  • Crunch lets Garchomp deal massive damage to Air Balloon Gholdengo, though it is niche.

  • Fire Fang, while weak, is Garchomp's best option against Corviknight when not Tera Fire.

Tera Types

  • Fire: When combined with Tera Blast, Tera Fire lets even Choice Scarf Garchomp possibly 2HKO Corviknight. The Fairy and Ice resistance is also very helpful.

  • Steel: Tera Steel is a good defensive alternative to Fire, retaining the useful Stealth Rock resistance and preforming better against Dragon- and Fairy-types.

  • Ground: The incredible power boost Earthquake gets from Tera Ground is worth considering, with Choice Band possibly 2HKOing physically defensive Dondozo with it.

Items

  • Choice Scarf: With Choice Scarf, Garchomp is able to outspeed and revenge kill key threats, such as Dragapult and Meowscarada, making it a potent late-game cleaner as well.

  • Choice Band: Choice Band trades revenge killing for wallbreaking, letting Garchomp reliably 2HKO Skeledirge and deal massive damage to Corviknight with Fire-type Tera Blast.

sets.name: Entry Hazard Setter
sets.description: With good natural bulk, a great typing, phazing, and both Spikes and Stealth Rock, Garchomp is an effective entry hazard setter that also checks common threats like Orichalcum Pulse Ceruledge. Swords Dance is an option over either entry hazard to pressure bulkier teams. Dragon Tail forces switches and potentially create a favorable situation for Garchomp and helps rack up even more entry hazard damage. As Garchomp does not have any reliable recovery, Leftovers is the preferred option on Fur Coat to give it Garchomp longevity, but Heavy-Duty Boots is great for opposing hazard-stack matchups. Fur Coat makes Garchomp it significantly better at handling targets such as Aerilate Dragonite and Adaptability Kingambit; however, Regenerator provides far better longevity, letting Garchomp set entry hazards multiple times. Due to Garchomp mainly being an entry hazard setter, it greatly appreciates teammates such as Good as Gold Skeledirge to keep the entry hazards up in the face of Defog and Rapid Spin. Garchomp also works well with offensive threats such as Sheer Force Iron Valiant, as the entry hazards can wear down Iron Valiant's checks into KO range. Garchomp struggles to check common attackers like Dragapult and Iron Valiant, so secondary checks like physically defensive Clodsire are appreciated.

sets.name: Stealth Rock Support
sets.description:
• Few Pokemon are more reliable at setting up Stealth Rock and phazing than Hippowdon.

  • Roar is a more direct phazing option than Yawn, and it is helpful against dangerous setup sweepers that may run Lum Berry, such as Dragonite and Garchomp.

  • Slack Off may seem like an obvious choice to make a defensive Pokemon last longer, but Hippowdon is often more focused on support than walling, so Slack Off doesn't fit every team.

  • Rock Tomb not only provides helpful speed control, but also pops Air Balloon on foes Hippowdon would otherwise struggle with, such as Gholdengo.

Tera Types

  • Grass: Hippowdon doesn't Terastallize often, but a Grass Tera type does help it against Breloom and Water-types such as Rotom-W.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpD with Careful: Patching up Hippowdon's weaker Special Defense is quite useful against special attackers, such as having a 6.3% chance of surviving Gholdengo's +2 Make It Rain, and Choice Specs Hydreigon no longer being able to 2HKO Sitrus Berry Hippowdon.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpD with Impish: A physically defensive spread means not even Choice Band Tera Dragon Dragapult will be able to 2HKO Sitrus Berry Hippowdon.

sets.name: Fur Coat
sets.description: Fur Coat Hippowdon is a remarkable physical wall thanks to its defensive stats, reliable recovery in Slack Off, and pure Ground typing, letting it check non-Mold Breaker offensive threats like Dragonite, Ceruledge, Kingambit, and Slither Wing. Whirlwind prevents foes like the aforementioned Dragonite from setting up. Rocky Helmet punishes the physical attackers it checks and lets it pseudo-spinblock Great Tusk, Cyclizar, and Iron Treads; alternatively, Leftovers gives it extra recovery without having to waste Slack Off PP. 25 Speed IVs let it underspeed Corviknight, allowing it to punish its Roost with Earthquake. Ice Scales users like Corviknight, Florges, and Blissey can compensate for Hippowdon's poor Special Defense and check foes like Chi-Yu and Iron Bundle. In return, they appreciate Hippowdon dealing with Ceruledge, Kingambit, and Slither Wing.

vgc2023.overview:
• Snow lets Abomasnow carve itself a niche in the current metagame.

  • Abomasnow is a decent offensive support Pokemon with Aurora Veil, which partners well with various Ice-types such as Baxcalibur, Cetitan, and Glaceon, as they gain a Defense boost in snow.

  • Abomasnow's offensive typing is well-suited in a metagame filled with Ground-, Dragon-, and Water-types such as Garchomp, Hydreigon, and Rotom-W.

  • Despite the Defense boost in snow, Abomasnow is still fairly specially frail with a poor set of weaknesses that leave it vulnerable to some of the most common special attackers in the format like Gholdengo and Armarouge.

sets.name: Support
sets.description:
• Giga Drain gives Abomasnow some longevity when behind Aurora Veil and lets it beat the likes of Rotom-W and Palafin which resist Blizzard. Earth Power is an alternative that hits Fire- and Steel-types like Torkoal and Gholdengo, notably OHKOing the former when Terastallized.

  • Abomansow runs items that help it overcome its crucial weaknesses. Focus Sash allows it to take any one hit, such as Rotom-H's Overheat, letting it set up Aurora Veil. Babiri Berry serves a similar purpose, allowing it to survive Gholdengo's Make It Rain and Tera Steel Hydreigon's Flash Cannon.

  • The Speed investment allows Abomsnow to outspeed Garchomp while in Tailwind.

  • Water is the primary Tera type used by Abomasnow, turning its Fire and Steel weaknesses into resistances. Ground is an alternative Tera type that allows it to fire off STAB-boosted Earth Powers, catching its common checks by surprise.

sets.name: Special Attacker
sets.description:
• In a metagame with very few special attackers, Magnezone carves a strong niche as an Electric-type attacker that can take out the common physical walls, such as Dondozo and Corviknight.

  • Magnezone’s STAB combination is difficult to switch into, especially with Choice Specs. Clodsire, the most noteworthy special wall in the format, can fall to an Analytic-boosted Flash Cannon or Steel Beam when carrying Choice Specs.

Tera Types

  • Fairy: A Fairy-type Tera Blast is very useful against common Dragon-types, most notably Garchomp.

  • Fighting: Gaining a resistance to Dark allows Magnezone to surprise and defeat Kingambit and Hydreigon, ignoring the former's Sucker Punch.

  • Grass: Grass has excellent defensive and offense synergy with Magnezone, especially through its utility against Ground-type attackers and Spore immunity. Most notably, Tera Blast Grass can OHKO max SpD Hippowdon with Choice Specs. However, many Pokemon tend to run Tera Fire, such as Azumarill and Garchomp, so Grass is less popular.

  • Flying: Flying has wonderful defensive synergy with Magnezone, reversing its Ground and Fighting weaknesses, and lets Tera Blast hit Grass-types harder.

  • Water: Offensively, Water serves a similar role to Grass, letting Tera Blast nail Ground-types. Water lacks a Ground resistance or a Spore immunity, but it gives Magnezone a much-appreciated Fire resistance for Pokemon like Skeledirge. Much like in the case of Grass, Tera Blast Water can OHKO Hippowdon, while also having the possibility of KOing Unaware Clodsire, although the risk it runs when considering Water Absorb should be noted.

  • Steel: The boost from Tera Steel makes Steel Beam absurdly powerful, with Analytic letting Choice Specs Magnezone OHKO even offensive Multiscale Dragonite!

EV Spreads

  • 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Modest: Running at least some Speed investment lets Magnezone outspeed critical Pokemon like Azumarill, Corviknight, Skeledirge, and Kingambit. 252 EVs give Magnezone a chance at outspeeding slow Mimikyu, Dragonite, Gholdengo, and Annihilape.

  • 188 HP / 252 SpA / 60 Spe with Modest: Magnezone's excellent typing means you often switch it into attacks, especially if you aren’t using Sturdy as an ability. This spread sacrifices some of Magnezone's Speed to raise its capabilities as a pivot. However, reducing the Speed EVs below 60 is not recommended, as it is the minimum required line to outspeed an uninvested Corviknight.

Items

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs gives Magnezone a devastating amount of power, with even Clodsire having trouble handling it.

  • Assault Vest: The increase in special bulk helps Magnezone against the myriad of choice item special attacking Dragon-types, like Hydreigon and Dragapult.

Abilities

  • Analytic: A Magnezone boosted by both Choice Specs and Analytic is incredibly hard to switch into, making it easier for Magnezone to generate momentum.

  • Sturdy: With Sturdy's guaranteed survivability and Magnezone's high damage output, Magnezone will very likely take down at least one Pokemon per game. Sturdy also helps Magnezone play around Dondozo, as it can safely come in on Fissure and use Volt Switch against it, which renders Yawn moot. However, if Magnezone switches into a Yawn and not Fissure, it should be noted that Dondozo often runs Protect to block Volt Switch and ensure Magnezone falls asleep.

  • Magnet Pull: Magnet Pull ensures Magnezone can eliminate Corviknight. In the case Magnezone uses Fighting as its Tera Type, Magnet Pull also allows it to beat both Kingambit and Tera Steel Hydreigon with more reliability.

sets.name: Choice Attacker
sets.description:
• Rotom-H sets itself apart from other Fire-types, with its Ground immunity and Volt Switch pivoting.

  • Trick gives Rotom-H an excellent tool against defensive foes, such as Dondozo and Skeledirge.

  • Make sure to get a Rotom-H with a neutral nature and then use a Timid Mint on it. This way, it can't be confused by any Berries given with Trick.

Tera Types

  • Electric: Electric is an easy Tera type to recommend, as it increases damage output and removes all of Rotom-H's weaknesses.

  • Fairy: A Fairy Tera typing with Tera Blast makes Rotom-H much better equipped to handle normally problematic Dragon-types, such as Garchomp and Dragapult.

  • Fire: When paired with Tera Blast, Rotom-H now has a much more reliable Fire-type STAB move than Overheat, at the cost of retaining several problematic weaknesses.

sets.name: Choice Attacker
sets.description:
• Rotom-W's Speed, which notably allows it to outpace Gholdengo, access to Volt Switch, and great typing make it an excellent pivot and revenge killer.

  • Trick is seriously worth considering for its ability to cripple defensive Pokemon such as Garganacl and Dondozo.

  • If using Trick, make sure Rotom-W is a neutral nature that has had a Timid Mint used on it. This way, Rotom-W can eat any Berry without getting confused.

Tera Types

  • Electric: Not only does the damage boost from Tera Electric come in handy, but it also removes any weaknesses Rotom-W has.

  • Fairy: When combined with Tera Blast, a Fairy Tera type lets Rotom-W take on Dragon-types such as Dragapult and Hydreigon far more effectively.

Items

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf lets Rotom-W outspeed major threats such as Dragapult and Meowscarada.

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs tends to be safer to Trick than Choice Scarf, and it gives a big power boost.

EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe: Maximizing Rotom-W's Special Attack is part of what makes it an effective revenge killer.

  • 252 HP / 4 SpD / 252 Spe: This spread sacrifices Rotom-W's revenge killing potential, but, in exchange, it makes it a better pivot, and the better bulk makes Rotom-W more suited to finding the right time to cripple a wall with Trick.

sets.name: Nasty Plot
sets.description:
• With a great typing, ability, and good bulk, Rotom-W makes for an effective user of Nasty Plot.

  • Tera Blast is usually used with Terastallization, but even beforehand, it provides a neutral attack to hit most Dragon-types with.

  • If using an Electric Tera type, Dark Pulse is Rotom-W's best option against Dragapult.

Tera Types

  • Fairy: With a Fairy Tera type, Rotom-W can turn the tables on its Dragon-type adversaries.

  • Electric: In addition to boosting the power of Electric-type attacks, all of Rotom-W's weaknesses are removed.

Items

  • Lum Berry: Lum Berry lets Rotom-W easily set up on Hippowdon, and avoid getting put to sleep by Dondozo.

  • Sitrus Berry: If Sleep isn't a big issue, Rotom-W appreciates the burst recovery Sitrus Berry provides.

EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe: Maximizing Speed with a Timid nature gives Rotom-W the jump on Gholdengo. If Gholdengo isn't an issue, a Modest nature will still outspeed Jolly Breloom.

  • 252 HP / 252 SpA / 4 SpD with Modest: Rotom-W's good bulk can be maximized instead of outspeeding Breloom; this spread avoids the 2HKO from Timid Gholdengo's Shadow Ball.

vgc2023.overview:
• Lilligant exists purely to facilitate Torkoal, providing excellent support with its blistering speed thanks to Chlorophyll. After You allows Torkoal to outspeed foes and hit incredibly hard with Eruption. Sleep Powder can disable a Pokemon that would otherwise threaten Torkoal or stop a sweep. Garchomp, notably, is vulnerable to sleep and is heavily damaged by Leaf Storm. Dondozo is similarly 2HKOed if it doesn't run Assault Vest, even after a Commander boost, and also susceptible to sleep.

  • As Torkoal excels on Trick Room teams, Lilligant will often end up teaming with Trick Room Pokemon. Indeedee's Psychic Terrain and Farigiraf's Armor Tail protect Lilligant from priority moves such as Dragonite's Extreme Speed, and both appreciate Lilligant's ability to disable Dark-type Pokemon such as Kingambit with Sleep Powder. After You lets Guts Hariyama turn the tables on faster Pokemon, and it protects Lilligant in return with Wide Guard and Fake Out. Annihilape appreciates Sleep Powder giving it free turns to use Bulk Up so it can sweep.

  • Talonflame and Murkrow can preempt Lilligant despite Chlorophyll with priority Tailwind, Taunt, and Quash. Similarly, Lilligant hates it when other weather setters hit the field due to its sudden drop in Speed.

sets.name: Chlorophyll Support
sets.description:
• Leaf Storm is Lilligant's strongest STAB option and gives it some offensive presence, notably checking Water- and Ground-types. Sleep Powder shuts down Pokemon that would otherwise threaten Lilligant or its partner and can punish switch-ins. After You is a phenomenal speed control tool that, with Lilligant's fantastic Speed via Chlorophyll, sets the stage for moves like Torkoal's Eruption.

  • Focus Sash is all but mandatory for Lilligant to function due to its frailty. Wide Lens is an option to shore up Sleep Powder's and Leaf Storm's consistency, but it leaves Lilligant vulnerable to OHKOs from most strong attackers.

  • Timid Lilligant is usually superior due to it outrunning Pokemon like Timid Gholdengo in Tailwind. Modest Lilligant can nab potential OHKOs on the likes of Maushold, bulky Rotom-W, and Tera Ground Garchomp, however, while having a very high chance of 2HKOing Garchomp before Terastallization.

  • Lilligant will rarely Terastallize but still has decent options. Tera Water lets it survive a Fire-type attack without giving it too many weaknesses. Tera Flying allows it to pair with an Earthquake user and continue to provide support. Tera Blast with Tera Ground covers Steel- and Fire-types such as Armarouge, Ceruledge, and Gholdengo but is generally not worth it.

  • Helping Hand gives Lilligant a good priority move to use in Trick Room, boosting Torkoal's spread damage to staggering levels. Quiver Dance allows Lilligant to maintain speed control outside of sun and gives its offense more bite. Energy Ball gives Lilligant a more consistent attack than Leaf Storm and is the attack of choice with Quiver Dance, but its unboosted damage leaves a lot to be desired. Any set using Quiver Dance or Energy Ball should run a Modest nature.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description:
• With good bulk, a solid defensive typing, and access to Spore, Clear Smog, and Regenerator, Amoonguss is a fantastic support and disruptor option.

  • Clear Smog prevents Amoonguss from getting set up on unless the opponent is Steel-type or has a Substitute up.

  • Hex both punishes foes put to sleep by Spore and hits Air Balloon Gholdengo.

  • Stomping Tantrum gets around Assault Vest Gholdengo.

Items

Leftovers: Leftovers gives Amoonguss longevity outside of Synthesis and Regenerator.

  • Black Sludge: Black Sludge is a great way to get around Item Clause if Leftovers is already in use. Note, if Amoonguss Terastallizes into a type that isn't Poison, it will take damage instead.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry is an alternative form of recovery, and it can be used regardless of Amoonguss's Tera type.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet punishes contact moves with residual damage, potentially breaking Focus Sash in the process.

Tera Types

  • Dark: While Amoonguss doesn't Terastallize often, Dark removes its weakness to Psychic-type attacks and makes Foul Play stronger, at the cost of gaining new weaknesses.

  • Poison: Poison removes Grass-type weaknesses, but makes Amoonguss weak to Ground-type attacks.

  • Steel: While it makes Amoonguss weak to Ground- and Fighting-type attacks, it also grants Amoonguss with a plethora of resistances, and it can be a tough Pokemon to break once foes like Breloom are KOed.

sets.name: Pivot
sets.description:
• Amoonguss has a great defensive profile, and this set can help it even further with a slow switch to another teammate once per game.

  • After using Leaf Storm, Eject Pack activates and Amoonguss is switched out; however, it can also be activated by other stat drops, such as Intimidate and Special Defense drops from Shadow Ball.

Tera Types

  • Dark: A Dark Tera type grants a Psychic-type immunity, along with a STAB Foul Play.

  • Poison: A Poison Tera type removes Amoonguss's Ice-, Fire-, and Flying-type weaknesses; and makes Clear Smog stronger due to its Base Power being increased to 60 along with the bonus STAB; hpwever this increases its vulnerability to Ground-type attacks.

  • Grass: A Grass Tera type takes advantage of Leaf Storm's high Base Power to make it hit even harder.

sets.name: Mold Breaker Funny Moments Compilation
sets.description:
• With its workable Speed, sky-high Attack stat, and the ever-valuable Mold Breaker, Haxorus is notable as one of the few setup sweepers not bothered by Mimikyu or Unaware.

  • With one Dragon Dance, it can outspeed most unboosted foes, but Choice Scarf users still cause issues, notably Hydreigon and Play Rough Meowscarada.

  • Dragon Claw may be worth using in place of Outrage to avoid locking Haxorus in.

  • Earthquake is extremely valuable on Haxorus due to Mold Breaker nullifying Levitate and Earth Eater, allowing Haxorus to hit foes like Rotom-W and Hydreigon hard without the need to lock into Outrage, and giving it a way to hit Orthworm hard at all

Items

  • Life Orb: Life Orb lets Haxorus deal damage much more effectively at the cost of recoil

  • Lum Berry: Lum Berry lets Haxorus safely set up against a foe that may use crippling status moves such as Will-O-Wisp and Spore.

Tera Types

  • Steel: Steel grants good security against opposing Ice-, Fairy-, and Dragon-types.

  • Fairy: Fairy maximizes Haxorus's security against opposing Dragon-types, specifically.

  • Electric: Electric provides a surefire way of dealing with Dondozo thanks to Tera Blast.

sets.name: HARBINGER
sets.description:
• With its high power and great STAB combination, Hydreigon makes for a formidable attacker.

  • Tera Blast can be used in tandem with an Electric Tera type to deal heavy damage to Dondozo.

  • Flamethrower is useful for hitting Steel-types such as Scizor and otherwise decent Dark Pulse switch-ins like Meowscarada.

  • Flash Cannon is Hydreigon’s best option to hit Fairy-types such as Mimikyu.

Items

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf patches up Hydreigon’s somewhat lackluster Speed, allowing it to threaten a wider portion of the metagame with its high-powered attacks.

  • Choice Specs: If your team has another Scarf user, Choice Specs Hydreigon is a nuclear wallbreaker that can pummel unsuspecting teams.

Tera Types

  • Steel: A Steel Tera type can be used to get around the many Dragon and Fairy-types that try to revenge kill Hydreigon, though it is still vulnerable to Mach Punch from Breloom.

  • Electric: Thanks to Levitate and a Tera type of Electric, Hydreigon lacks any sort of weaknesses, and gains a powerful Tera Blast to hit Dondozo with, being able to break past it without fearing Fissure.

  • Dark: Tera-boosted Dark Pulse is an absurdly powerful weapon, and when coupled with its flinch rate, Tera Dark Hydreigon can potentially muscle its way out of otherwise hopeless situations.

  • Fire: Terastallizing into the fire typing will grant Hydreigon a resistance to Fairy-types while removing its weakness to Fighting-types and giving it a good move to hit Steel-types with. However, unlike Tera Steel it does not grant a resistance to Dragon, and it also gives Hydreigon a few new weaknesses.

sets.name: Versatile Attacker
sets.description:
• Hydreigon's useful support movepool can add quite a bit of unpredictability to its offensive potential.

  • Note that this Hydreigon is fully capable of running three attacking moves with one support move.

  • Substitute is excellent for scouting Terastallization and punishes common status users such as Yawn Dondozo.

  • When Terastallizing Hydreigon, Thunder Wave is often the safest move against other faster Dragon-types that Terastallize, such as Dragapult and Salamence.

  • Taunt is good for getting the edge against defensive foes such as Clodsire.

  • Nasty Plot makes Hydreigon a surprisingly dangerous sweeper against slower teams.

Tera Types

  • Steel: A Steel Tera type has fantastic synergy with Levitate, helping Hydreigon against Dragon- and Fairy-types without the dreaded Ground weakness.

  • Dark: Since so few Pokemon resist Dark-type attacks, this is a good Tera type for cleaning up late game.

  • Poison: With a Poison Tera type, Hydreigon can do well against Fairy-types without fear of powerful Fighting-type attacks.

  • Fire: When using Flamethrower, a Fire Tera type is handy for both the Fairy resistance and a better matchup against Kingambit.

Items

  • Leftovers: If using Substitute, Leftovers's extra bit of recovery helps reduce its risk.

  • Life Orb: A simple power boost still comes in handy, even if only using two attacks.

  • Black Glasses: If a teammate is already using Life Orb, Black Glasses is a good compromise.

sets.name: Stealth Rock Support
sets.description:
• Hydreigon's new access to Stealth Rock makes it a surprisingly effective offensive support Pokemon.

  • Taunt effectively shuts down common support leads like Hippowdon and Clodsire.

  • Thunder Wave is a powerful deterrent against offensive foes and can even stop sweepers in emergency situations when used with Focus Sash.

Tera Types

  • Steel: Thanks to Levitate, a Steel Tera type is an incredible defensive typing for Hydreigon, giving it an advantage over Fairy- and Dragon-types.

  • Poison: Tera Poison is a good alternative to Steel, with fewer resistances but an important Fighting-type resistance.

  • Dark: If using Life Orb, boosting Dark-type attacks can make for some surprising late-game cleaning.

  • Fire: Fire-type Hydreigon is better against Kingambit and Fairy-types.

Items

  • Leftovers: If using Taunt, Leftovers is the best choice for giving Hydreigon longevity against defensive foes such as Corviknight.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash makes setting up Stealth Rock a much easier task against offensive teams. Be warned that it doesn't stop Dragapult's Dragon Darts.

  • Life Orb: Life Orb lets Hydreigon be played more offensively if setting Stealth Rock isn't needed.

  • Dark Glasses: Dark Glasses work if a teammate is using Life Orb.

vgc2023.overview:
• Hydreigon is a strong contender for the title of best Pokemon in the Series 1 metagame thanks to its diverse movepool and high damage output.

  • Terastallization proves to be a boon for Hydreigon, as it can get rid of its ever-burdening Fairy-type weakness by changing to much more beneficial types such as Steel.

  • Hydreigon has a good offensive typing, leaving few Pokemon able to switch in safely. It is one of the best checks to Gholdengo and also pairs well with it, forming a fundamentally powerful core when used with Tailwind support from Murkrow. Armarouge and Garchomp also synergize well with Hydreigon, covering for Steel-types, which it may not be able to damage effectively depending on its Tera type. Hydreigon can, however, struggle against damage reduction such as Snarl and Light Screen, with the latter coming especially from Grimmsnarl, which can easily take its STAB moves and OHKO it back with Spirit Break if Hydreigon is not Terastallized. Repeated usage of Draco Meteor can also make Hydreigon deal unimpressive amounts of damage, but this can be counteracted with Haze from Murkrow, allowing it to continue dealing devastating damage.

sets.name: Life Orb
sets.description:
• Tailwind allows Hydreigon to support allies such as Armarouge and Sylveon, forming strong offensive combinations. The third moveslot depends on Hydreigon's Tera Type and can be changed accordingly. Protect is utilized on teams with a different primary Tailwind setter such as Murkrow, but Hydreigon can still be kept as a secondary setter.

  • Life Orb lets Hydreigon dish out consistent damage without the need to set up.

  • The Steel Tera type synergizes wonderfully with Hydreigon's original typing and Levitate, allowing it to resist a plethora of common types such as Fairy, Ground, and, Dragon. This makes Hydreigon one of the best checks to Tera Ground Garchomp, which cannot hit Hydreigon with Earthquake and deals minimal damage to it with Dragon Claw and Rock Slide. A Fire Tera type allows Hydreigon to beat opposing Tera Steel Pokemon such as Hydreigon and Salamence. The Poison Tera type lets Hydreigon maintain the resistance to Fairy that Steel and Fire possess while also gaining an additional resistance to Fighting, crucial against the likes of Annihilape, Hariyama, and Close Combat Lycanroc. It is only left with Psychic as a relevant weakness, synergizing well with its original Dark typing. Tera Blast should be used instead of Flash Cannon for coverage against Fairy-types on sets that use Tera Poison.

sets.name: Scope Lens
sets.description:
• Heat Wave is a great coverage move to deal with Steel-types that can withstand Draco Meteor such as Gholdengo and Kingambit.

  • Scope Lens takes advantage of the +2 critical hit rate from Focus Energy, allowing Hydreigon to always critical hit, especially through Draco Meteor Special Attack drops and other means of damage reduction such as Light Screen.

  • A Timid nature lets Hydreigon speed tie other Hydreigon as the raw power it gains from having the ability to always critical hit is enough. A Modest nature can, however, be utilized on teams with good methods of speed control such as Tailwind from Murkrow.

  • The Fire Tera type powers up Hydreigon's Heat Wave, letting it OHKO Kingambit on a critical hit and nearly OHKO Amoonguss, and gives Hydreigon a Fairy resistance.

sets.name: Assault Vest
sets.description:
• Snarl is an immensely useful tool for reducing the damage dealt by strong special attackers such as Gholdengo, Psychic Terrain-boosted Expanding Force Armarouge, and opposing Hydreigon.

  • Flash Cannon in combination with the Steel Tera type is used as a way to keep Fairy-types such as Grimmsnarl and Sylveon in check. Heat Wave is used as coverage to hit opposing Steel-types, but Dark Pulse is usually preferred over it for its ability to deal consistent damage to most other types overall.

  • Assault Vest makes Hydreigon a very potent sponge against special moves when combined with its ability to use Snarl for further reduction, especially for its teammates. Its high Special Attack lets it deal respectable damage despite running a more support-oriented set.

  • The Speed EVs allow Hydreigon to outrun maximum Speed Timid Gholdengo, and as a result, Armarouge of all Speed investments, allowing it to immediately use Snarl and lower their damage output. The Special Attack EVs let it always 2HKO maximum HP and 4 Special Defense Armarouge and uninvested Gholdengo with Dark Pulse. The Special Defense EVs make -1 Modest maximum Special Attack Choice Specs Gholdengo's Shadow Ball only a possible 5HKO on Tera Steel Hydreigon, while Make It Rain rocks a petty chance to even 7HKO. -1 Armarouge Aura Sphere also only has about a 50% chance to 4HKO Hydreigon. Note that Hydreigon should not be Terastallized against Armarouge to maintain the Fire resistance and Psychic immunity, as it is still weak to Aura Sphere when Terastallized. Opposing Tera Fire Hydreigon never OHKOes Tera Steel Hydreigon with Life Orb Heat Wave when spread damage is accounted for, allowing Hydreigon to retaliate with Snarl. The physical bulk allows Hydreigon to never be 2HKOed by maximum Attack Adamant Annihilape Drain Punch and Jolly maximum Attack Garchomp Brick Break.

  • Steel Tera type is the best defensive type for Hydreigon, allowing it to hard check most special attackers such as Gholdengo and Sylveon while holding its own against Pokemon such as Grimmsnarl. Poison Tera type, on the other hand, lets Hydreigon maintain the Fairy resistance that Steel gives it while also awarding it an additional resistance to Fighting in the face of Pokemon such as Annihilape and Hariyama. Tera Blast should be used instead of Flash Cannon to hit Fairy-types on Tera Poison sets.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
Welcome to the next generation of Battle Stadium Singles! In this new and exciting metagame, new ideas are constantly developing, so this analysis will constantly be updated to reflect metagame trends.

If you feel this analysis is not up to date, feel free to check out the thread for this Pokemon and post suggestions. For resources on Series 1 in general, check out this thread.

sets.name: Quiver Dance Sweeper
sets.description:
• With Flame Body, several physical attackers like Annihilape, Meowscarada, and Mimikyu can be crippled on contact, which helps a lot.

  • Quiver Dance lets Volcarona sweep, alongside the possibility of Fiery Dance further boosting Special Attack. Fire Blast can be used if greater damage output is wanted.

  • Giga Drain is the best coverage option for Volcarona, as it helps it deal with Water-type Pokémon, as well as recover a good amount of HP.

  • Water-type Tera Blast helps Volcarona deal with Pokemon like Skeledirge, Ceruledge, and other Volcarona. Volcarona with Bug Buzz can also be used, as it is a very powerful STAB move and helps Volcarona deal with Hydreigon.

Tera Types

  • Water: Terastallizing into the Water typing nullifies Volcarona's most common weakness in Rock-type. Tera Blast damages Hydreigon decently prior to Terastallizing. Water-type Tera Blast is also the best option Volcarona has to hit Skeledirge.

  • Grass: The Grass typing strengthens Giga Drain and nullifies Volcarona's weakness to Water-types, most notably helping against Dondozo and Rotom-W.

  • Fire: Terastallizing into Fire typing makes Volcarona's Fire Blast even more powerful.

Items

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: It is the best option on Volcarona, as it circumvents its crippling Stealth Rock weakness.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry helps Volcarona accrue boosts more easily with Quiver Dance and lets it avoid being 2HKOed by Mimikyu and Dragonite.

  • Life Orb: This is the most reliable tool for helping Volcarona sweep in the late-game.

sets.name: Bulkarona
sets.description:
• With recovery and massive investments in bulk, Volcarona is capable of setting up multiple Quiver Dances, giving it new opportunities to sweep.

  • Even before Terastallization, Tera Blast can come in handy for hitting Hydreigon.

  • Giga Drain is Volcarona's best shot at beating Water-types such as Rotom-W and Palafin; note that Dondozo is not 2HKOed.

  • Will-O-Wisp is great for punishing boosting physical attackers that may Terastallize, such as Kingambit.

  • Bug Buzz is Volcarona's best tool against foes behind a Substitute, and hits Hydreigon hard.

  • Though it can be difficult to fit-in, Substitute allows Volcarona to punish users of status moves, such as sleep moves from Amoonguss, Breloom, and Sylveon, and Toxic from Water Absorb Clodsire.

  • The given EV spread maximizes Volcarona's overall bulk, while outspeeding Meowscarada after Quiver Dance.

Tera Types

  • Fairy: A Fairy Tera type lets Volcarona punish foes like Choice Band Dragapult, at the cost of being far more vulnerable to Tera Steel Dragons and Kingambit.

  • Water: Besides removing all of Volcarona's old weaknesses, a Water Tera type also 2HKOes Skeledirge with Tera Blast.

  • Grass: With a Grass Tera type, Volcarona can now 2HKO most Dondozo with Giga Drain and is better insulated against Rotom-W revenge kills.

  • Flying: While a Flying Tera Type isn't a huge help defensively, the immunity to Fissure makes Volcarona better equipped to handle Dondozo.

  • Fire: A Fire Tera type simply gives Fiery Dance more power, and makes sense if not using Tera Blast.

Items

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: Stealth Rock is common enough that this is the safest item for Volcarona to hold.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry gives Volcarona more durability against teams that lack hazards.

  • Safety Goggles: This allows Volcarona to handle Spore from Breloom and Amoonguss without Terastallizing.

sets.name: SOLAR FLARE (Choiced Attacker)
sets.description:
• With its high Speed and immediate power, Volcarona is a good candidate for a choice item.

  • With its high chance to boost Volcarona’s Special Attack, Fiery Dance is a potent cleaning tool.

  • Bug Buzz is a good secondary STAB move that allows Volcarona to hit foes hiding behind a substitute.

  • Overheat deals good immediate damage, which can allow Volcarona to muscle past otherwise annoying walls.

  • Giga Drain is Volcarona’s best option to hit Dondozo.

  • Tera Blast can be used with various Tera types to augment Volcarona’s coverage, helping it get around its somewhat limited movepool.

  • Since Stealth Rock is relatively less common in Battle Stadium Singles, Volcarona can serve as a rather reliable pivot with U-turn.

Items

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf Volcarona outspeeds the entire unboosted metagame, allowing it to revenge kill and pivot very effectively.

  • Choice Specs: With the extra power offered by Choice Specs, Volcarona becomes even more difficult to wall, even potentially breaking through some resists with its attacks.

Tera Types

  • Fire: A Fire Tera type slightly improves Volcarona’s defensive profile while boosting Fiery Dance and Overheat even further, allowing it to grab some surprising KOs.

  • Fairy: When paired with Tera Blast, a Fairy Tera type allows Volcarona to better handle the many Dragon-types in the metagame; notably, it is Volcarona's best option for beating Dragonite.

  • Grass: A Grass Tera type allows Volcarona to resist the many Water-type attacks aimed at it and gives it a better chance at breaking past Dondozo.

sets.name: Physically Defensive
sets.description: Volcarona's great defensive typing and solid bulk makes it a good defensive pivot for threats such as non-Stakeout Iron Valiant and Slither Wing while checking Iron Bundle and Quaquaval with Desolate Land. Morning Sun gives Volcarona a boosted recovery under Desolate Land, and Will-O-Wisp enables Volcarona to cripple its switch-ins. The 32 Speed EVs allow Volcarona to outpace and burn uninvested Garchomp with Will-O-Wisp. Specially defensive walls like Ice Scales Corviknight appreciate Volcarona's ability to switch into to mixed threats like Iron Valiant. Specially offensive Ghosts like Dragapult and Gholdengo also appreciate Volcarona's ability to spread burns and allow them to utilize Hex at full power. Heavy-Duty Boots is vital for Volcarona's longevity, so it is recommended to pair Volcarona with a Knock Off switchin like Great Tusk or Iron Hands to mitigate the chance of being vulnerable to entry hazards.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description: An EV spread of 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpD should be used on Fur Coat variants.

sets.name: CUTESY CRUSADER (Defensive)
sets.description:
• With its good bulk and Special Attack, Sylveon is quite a dangerous threat and is also hard to take down.

  • With the boost from Pixilate, Hyper Voice becomes Sylveon’s best option for STAB, notably bypassing Substitute.

  • A Fire-type Tera Blast provides excellent coverage against the many Steel-types that try to take advantage of Sylveon.

  • Wish can be used to keep Sylveon healthy, as well as its teammates.

  • Shadow Ball offers important coverage on Gholdengo without demanding that Sylveon Terastallize.

  • Quick Attack, though weak, can be very helpful for finishing off foes that have hung on against Sylveon or its teammates, and thanks to Pixilate, Ghost-types cannot safely switch in to absorb the move.

Tera Types

  • Fire: Beyond improving Tera Blast, a Fire Tera type grants Sylveon resistances to Steel and Fairy, allowing it to take on foes it would otherwise have to run from, such as Gholdengo.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description:
• With its good natural bulk, Sylveon can serve as a potent attacker and decent revenge killer.

  • Thanks to Pixilate, Hyper Voice is Sylveon’s best STAB option, notably bypassing Substitute.

  • Tera Blast serves as a good alternate STAB attack once Sylveon has Terastallized, providing highly valuable coverage against the Steel-types that could otherwise exploit it, like Scizor.

  • Shadow Ball hits foes such as Mimikyu and Gholdengo super effectively, and it means Sylveon does not have to Terastallize to hit Gholdengo for good damage.

  • Though it is weak, Quick Attack gives valuable priority for picking off weakened threats, and thanks to Pixilate, surprise users of Tera Ghost aren't able to absorb it.

Items

  • Assault Vest: Assault Vest lets even offensive Sylveon be specially resilient, but it doesn't allow Wish or Yawn to be used.

  • Choice Specs: With the boost from Choice Specs, Sylveon is a surprisingly potent wallbreaker, making the most out of its many opportunities to switch in.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA: This spread capitalizes on Sylveon's good natural bulk while maximizing its power.

  • 4 Def / 252 SpA / 252 Spe: While no bulk investment makes Sylveon more difficult to safely get in, Speed investment allows it to outrun and threaten a wider range of foes, such as Scizor and Corviknight.

vgc2023.overview:
• Sylveon is a great Pokemon in Series 1 thanks to a strong Pixilate-boosted Hyper Voice, potentially further boosted by Throat Spray and Calm Mind.Its Fairy typing is especially strong in a metagame with plenty of good Dark-, Dragon-, and Fighting-types like Grimmsnarl, Hydreigon, Hariyama, and Annihilape.

  • Sylveon's Speed means that it can effectively take advantage of both Trick Room and Tailwind from Pokemon like Amrarouge and Murkrow; 212 Speed EVs, taken from Sylveon's HP, can be run on Tailwind teams to outpace Dragapult.

  • Sylveon can struggle against Fire-types like Ceruledge and Armarouge, which makes Pokemon like Rotom-W, Paldean Tauros-A, and Dragonite good teammates. Sylveon also appreciates Pokemon like Ceruledge and Garchomp that can handle Gholdengo.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description:
• Tera Blast + Fire Tera type gives Sylveon a strong matchup against Steel-types like Gholdengo and Tera Steel Hydreigon. When not Terastallized, Tera Blast is boosted by Pixiliate and is still useful for dealing damage when faced by Wide Guard users like Armarouge. Fairy Tera type makes Sylveon's Hyper Voice even more powerful, letting it 2HKO even naturally bulky Pokemon like Kingambit and Hatterene; this can be used over Fire Tera type on teams that can afford the loss in effectiveness against Steel-types like Gholdengo. Ground Tera type is an option that lets Sylveon hit opposing Fire-types like Ceruledge and Armarouge hard, retain good damage against Steel-types, and avoid a burdensome weakness to Garchomp, though Sylveon strongly values the resistance to Steel that a Fire Tera type grants.

  • Substitute is good for blocking Amoonguss's Spore, preventing its Clear Smog from resetting Sylveon's stat boosts, and taking advantage of defensive play. Quick Attack is an option that can prove particularly useful against Tailwind teams, picking off Pokemon brought down to their Focus Sash like Murkrow and Kilowattrel, as well as other weakened Pokemon.

  • Calm Mind is an option that can be particularly potent on bulkier teams with damage mitigation from Pokemon like Gyarados and Grimmsnarl to help Sylveon set up.

  • Throat Spray is a no-drawback way of improving Sylveon's offense; a +1 Hyper Voice will 2HKO most offensive Pokemon that do not resist Fairy. Life Orb lets Sylveon immediately 2HKO or nearly 2HKO most offensive Pokemon at the cost of recoil that could put it in range of attacks like Tera Ground Garchomp's Earthquake. Leftovers is good alongside Calm Mind on bulkier teams where Sylveon wants to stick around longer. Safety Goggles grants Sylveon immunity to Amoonguss's Spore.

  • On Tailwind teams Sylveon can run 212 Speed EVs, taken from its HP stat, to outpace Dragapult.

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description:
• Choice Specs is Sylveon's most immediately powerful set, it can 2HKO most offensive Pokemon that do not resist Fairy. It's much more immediately powerful than Throat Spray Sylveon and a bit stronger than Life Orb Sylveon without wearing itself down with recoil, helping it stay out of range of attacks like Tera Ground Garchomp's Earthquake.

  • Tera Blast + a Fire Tera Type lets Sylveon hit Fairy-resistant foes like Gholdengo and Amoonguss hard, and the typing is defensively useful against the former. Tera Blast is also useful by itself in the face of Wide Guard, giving Sylveon an option besides Hyper Beam, which has a turn of recharge, for a single target Fairy-type attack.

  • Shadow Ball hits Armarouge, Ceruledge, and Skeledirge, which resist Fairy, and is a strong option against Gholdengo and Gengar if Terastallizing is off the table.

  • Hyper Beam OHKOes bulky Pokemon like Rotom-W and Kingambit that can take Hyper Voice.

  • 212 Speed EVs, taken from Sylveon's HP stat, let it outpace Dragapult on Tailwind teams.

sets.name: Ice Scales
sets.description: Ice Scales Toxapex utilizes its remarkable special bulk and valuable defensive typing to check offensive threats such as Chi-Yu, Dragapult, Iron Valiant, and non-Mold Breaker Iron Bundle. The combination of Toxic + Haze lets Toxapex shut down and eventually beat setup sweepers that try to overwhelm it such as Dragonite, Ceruledge, and Volcarona. Liquidation pressures Toxic-immune foes like Clodsire and Kingambit. Toxic Spikes is an option to spread status more easily, which works well with Hex users such as Gholdengo and Dragapult. Fur Coat users like Corviknight and Hippowdon can check threatening foes like Great Tusk and Iron Hands for it; Corviknight's Defog also relieves entry hazard pressure from Toxapex if not running Heavy-Duty Boots, while Hippowdon's Stealth Rock works well with Toxapex's poison to spread further passive damage.

sets.name: Physically Defensive
sets.description: Palossand's unique typing and good defensive bulk make it a solid physically defensive wall that can check the likes of Iron Hands, Slither Wing, and non-Stakeout Great Tusk while also spinblocking against Great Tusk and Iron Treads. Stealth Rock can provide entry hazard support, whereas Skill Swap lets Palossand check Aerilate Dragonite and better handle offensive Great Tusk and Regenerator switch-ins. Palossand pairs well with specially defensive walls such as Ice Scales Corviknight and Garganacl that appreciate its ability to take physical hits. Frail offensive attackers that are susceptible to priority like Iron Bundle and Chien-Pao also appreciate Palossand's ability to soak up offensive hits. Palossand can have a tough time dealing with specially offensive Ghost-types like Dragapult and Gholdengo, so paring it with Ting-Lu or Kingambit is recommended. Ceruledge can also pose a problem to Palossand, as it can 2HKO Palossand after Swords Dance and survive any one attack, so paring it with something that can handle Ceruledge like Great Tusk or Iron Hands is advised.
